ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 117
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Crystal Oh man *shivers at the thought* at level 9.  Man they must be hounding you day and night.  And Sow Whore works *big smile* I like the name and it
ygData.messageBody:
Hi Crystal

Oh man *shivers at the thought* at level 9. Man they must be hounding
you day and night. And Sow Whore works *big smile* I like the name and
it fits :)

I feel bad about asking for cash for Sow. Get a sob story on how they
lost there bodies or I just Sow them to shut them up :) Now higher
levels
or folks that have been playing a while will ask nicely and give me cash
for
it. While the beggers just will shout and don't even say thanks. Some
do but most run off. And then they wonder why I will not heal/buff/Sow
them another time.

And what they do to you sounds about normal. When I played a cleric it
seemed that they wanted me to heal them in a battle but would not take
the
time to help me or wait.

It sounds like the Higher levels are the best to give Sow too. And like
you
I always like them :)

Ah an Enchanter, great class to play, but man I can just see how much he
gets bugged. I alway give SOW and the buffs I have if I get breezed.

Cool, my husband ( got him hooked on EQ ) want to get married in the
game too.
Anyone know how to do it?

Your guild sounds great :)

Never got into the skills like baking, always was too broke after buy
spells :)
I'm going to have to try baking it sounds like fun and easy.

________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 3
> Date: Sun, 2 Jul 2000 17:57:24 -0600 (MDT)
> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
> Subject: Re: Grouping and Level-envy
>
> One good way to group is to try small groups. Lots of people seem to
> think that you should try and get groups of 5 or 6, but groups of 2 or 3
> can work really well.
>
> As a druid, you are an ideal partner for a tank. Pure tanks like warriors
> and rogues are usually happy to group with a healer.
>
> I use to dislike twinking, but over time I have come to understand it. I
> have twinked myself. For me twinking is simply to avoid aspects of the
> game that I no longer find as entertaining. Usually with twinks, as with
> any other players, it's fairly quick to figure out if they're decent
> people or not. If someone is nice, whether they are twinked or not,
> they're nice.
>
> Tina
>

Hi Tina

I like small groups too. Now in Highpass with the Orcs a big group is
needed, but
that is the only time I have seen that you need to be in a big group.
Now I have
not been to Kurank yet so I'm not sure about there.

And yep I must say I'm Twinked, but I got the stuff from my old cleric
and tank.
When out and got the stuff myself or on a guild raid. So I don't feel
bad about
it.

When someone asks where I got something ( twinked with armor Lockjaw
vest - I was lucky to get
out of that fight alive :) , shield from named gnoll in highpass, and
screaming mace )
I tell them they are gifts. If they get mad and want to know more they
get mad but most
folks just smile and seem to understand. Think they are twinks too :)


Ranalla the Lost Druid of Prexus
